greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular numbers of the form k^2 + k + 1.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1001
maple: Do[a = n(n + 1) + 1; b = Floor[Sqrt[2a]]; If[b(b + 1) == 2a, Print[a]], {n, 1, 106}]
mathematica: Select[Table[n^2+n+1,{n,0,206*10^6}],OddQ[Sqrt[8#+1]]&] (* The program takes a long time to run. *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 22 2017 *)
program: (MAGMA) m:=50; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!( (x^4 +2*x^3 -16*x^2 +2*x +1)/((1-x)*(1-6*x+x^2)*(1+6*x+x^2)) )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 01 2018
(Sage) s=((x^4 +2*x^3 -16*x^2 +2*x +1)/((1-x)*(1-6*x+x^2)*(1+6*x+x^2))).series(x, 50); s.coefficients(x, sparse=False) # _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 01 2018
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 02 2002
ext: Program and terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_
